description.range: The Coral catshark can be found from India to Southeast Asia.
description.fact:
Coral catshark females tuck their eggs into the crevices in rocks. 
These eggs, which take 4-6 months to hatch, look like a small purse and are often referred to as “mermaid's purses”.

description.range: The Epaulette shark is found in the shallow waters of Northern Australia and Papua New Guinea.
description.fact: Epaulette sharks can use their fins in a walking motion as they undulate their bodies, helping them move through coral reefs. This motion can even help them move on land between tide pools in search of food.
